ygData.subject: Re: skills
ygData.msgSnippet: If you are at your max in a skill level, and attempt to train, the trainer will tell you that you have already reached your max in that skill and can t train
ygData.messageBody:
If you are at your max in a skill level, and attempt to train, the trainer
will tell you that you have already reached your max in that skill and can't
train it anymore. Doesn't matter what you try, if a skill is maxed in a
level, you have to go up a level for the skill to increase.

Mik
----- Original Message -----
From: Curtis Bennett <die_kluge@...>
To: <EQ-Clerics@onelist.com>
Sent: Wednesday, October 20, 1999 10:38 AM
Subject: Re: [EQ-Clerics] skills


> From: "Curtis Bennett" <die_kluge@...>
>
> Even if I spend points into it? Has anyone tried that? I think I
> might do it. I'm pretty sure it still shows up on my training screen
> when I go to the guildmaster. Seems like I could spend the plat and
> raise it. It will certainly let me. I'll try it sometime, let the
> list know what happens.
>
>
> >From: AoS/Aosinator <darshan@...>
> >
> > >It's 75, actually. Can I take it past 75 by spending training points?
> > >You didn't answer my question.
> >
> >The maximum that a cleric can attain in dodge, is 75 I believe. Once it
> >reaches it's maximum, it can go no higher.
> >
